TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed JoinLobbyCompletedEventArgs extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerEventArgs
Public NotInheritable Class JoinLobbyCompletedEventArgs Implements MultiplayerEventArgs
type JoinLobbyCompletedEventArgs = class interface MultiplayerEventArgs interface __IJoinLobbyCompletedEventArgsPublicNonVirtuals

Docs.summary: Notifies the title when the client joins a lobby. Once join succeeds, the member becomes part of the lobby session, and can use data in the session to connect to other lobby members.
Docs.remarks:
To join a friend's lobby, call the the JoinLobby(handleId) operation using the handleId you back get from MultiplayerService::GetActivitiesForSocialGroupAsync(). If the user accepts an invite or joined a friend's game via the shell, the title will get a protocol activated, in which case you should call JoinLobby(IProtocolActivatedEventArgs^).
For scenarios where the local user has not been added, you can pass the local user object part of the join_lobby API. If the invited user is not added via MultiplayerLobbySession::AddLocalUser() or through JoinLobby(), then JoinLobby() will fail and provide the InvitedXboxUserId that the invite was sent for as part of the JoinLobbyCompletedEventArgs.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property InvitedXboxUserId As String

Docs.summary: Invited Xbox User ID of the member that the invite was sent for.
